intro: Passerina virgata var. broussonetii, commonly known as the Broussonet's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Its botanical features make it well adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
